Method Detail

alternateParse

public boolean alternateParse(java.lang.String formatString,
                              OptionStore optionStore,
                              RuleStore ruleStore,
                              java.lang.String[] args)
                       throws Tokenizer.IllegalCharacterException,
                              Tokenizer.UnknownOptionException,
                              AutomatonException,
                              InvalidOptionValueException
If there is exactly one way to parse the command line then it parses the command line and returns true, otherwise returns false. Errors in the DSL may cause this function to throw exception. Exceptions may also be thrown if options refuse to set their values from the given string. TODO(rgrig): The interface of this function should clearly separate errors in the DSL from errors in the command line.

Throws:
Tokenizer.IllegalCharacterException
Tokenizer.UnknownOptionException
AutomatonException
InvalidOptionValueException

parse

public boolean parse(java.lang.String formatString,
                     OptionStore optionStore,
                     RuleStore ruleStore,
                     java.lang.String[] args)
              throws Tokenizer.IllegalCharacterException,
                     Tokenizer.UnknownOptionException
Parse the given commandline.

Parameters:
formatString - the format regular expression in a string form
ruleStore - collection of fly rules that should be used during parsing
optionStore - collection of options that will be matched against the input
args - the commandline as given to the main method
Returns:
true iff the commmandline has been successfully parsed
Throws:
Tokenizer.IllegalCharacterException
Tokenizer.UnknownOptionException
